timeline.text: Alright, so I'm gonna try something new. I'm gonna try to be really fast, but still tell you everything that I think you need to know.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: So a class in programming can be described as an object in the real world and.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: Classes in programming are also often referred to as objects and.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: So object oriented programming just means utilizing classes in your code.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: So if you want to write good code, then you really need to know how to use classes.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: So let me break this down for you.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: Here you see a class written in Python and that looks simple enough, right?
timeline.label: question

timeline.text: But at this point it doesn't really do anything for us.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: So let's make this a little bit more useful and let's add some attributes to this class and that just means let's add some stuff.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: That a person would have metrics and values.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: Anything that describes a person really so what could this be what features does a person have?
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: Well, they have an age right and.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: A weight a height and.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: Lastly, they have a first name and a last name.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: So now we've added attributes to our person class and we can now start using this class in other parts of our code.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: We can create what is called an instance of our person class.
timeline.label: question

timeline.text: We can make a new person that will be our user let's say and here comes a really cool part.
timeline.label: transition

timeline.text: So now we're able to access the attributes of person and set them for our user.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: So for instance, what would the first name of our user person be?
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: Well, let's name them John. How old would John be? Well, I'm 25 so I'm just gonna go with 25.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: What were the weight of John be? I'm gonna go with 80 for now and this could of course represent any metric you want.
timeline.label: transition

timeline.text: So you could represent grams pounds or kilos doesn't really matter.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: So now then when we use our user we will be able to access all the different attributes of our person class and.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: First name last name age height weight, etc and.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: Whatever else we might add to the person class in the future.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: So for instance to test this we could try printing the user's catchphrase to the terminal and how we do that.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: It's just type in print and in parentheses user dot catchphrase and that will then print whatever.
timeline.label: action

timeline.text: We have set the catchphrase for our user to be.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: We can also add methods in our class and access them the same way that we would with attributes and.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: The class might then end up looking something this.
timeline.label: transition

timeline.text: So what we can do now is we can get our user to walk or run.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: So user dot walk would then print walking to the terminal you can create a class for anything that you can imagine.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: So for instance, let's say a bottle of water what attributes would it have?
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: Well, it would have volume how much could it contain it would probably have what type of bottle it is is it wine soda milk?
timeline.label: action

timeline.text: Whatever and what methods would it have so what can you do with a bottle? Well, you can pour it you can fill it.
timeline.label: explanation

timeline.text: You can probably recycle it creating classes is something that may take some time to get used to it.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: Took me some time to get used to it and I would recommend just practicing by creating classes for things that you see and have around you and.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: This will teach you how to abstract real-world things and represent them in code.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: Which is pretty much what programming is all about and if you learn to do this.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: Well, then you pretty much won half the battle when it comes to learning to code.
timeline.label: transition

timeline.text: Okay, I hope I did that well.
timeline.label: statement

timeline.text: I tried to be really fast and I hope I explained it well and that you got something out of this and.
timeline.label: statement
